p:
The whooping crane population has grown at approximately 3.5% annually (geometric mean, n = 61, SD = 10.7) since 1950 but varied from −19.4% to 33.3%. Using all survey data, recruitment of juvenile birds (
R ^
; ratio of hatch‐year to after‐hatch‐year birds) into the winter population of whooping cranes ranged from 0 to 0.4 (geometric mean = 0.145, n = 61, SD = 0.090). Annual whooping crane survival (
S ^
) ranged from 0.645 to 1.0 (geometric mean = 0.906, n = 60, SD = 0.060).
